description: From Latin convolvulus (“bindweed; caterpillar”), from convolvō (“convolve”).

entries.meaning: (botany) Any of several plants, of the genus Convolvulus, found in temperate climates, having small trumpet-shaped flowers.
examples: In this painting he uses the lovers for his narrative and makes his symbolic points with the convolvulus, signifying entanglements, climbing up the steps.

entries.meaning: (zoology) A species of hawkmoth, Agrius convolvuli.
examples: Already the convolvulus moth was spinning over the flowers.
